function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Empirical analysis based on pca and cluster analysis","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Calculation of soundness based on financial variables","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Preliminary tests for kmo and bartlett tests","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of common opinion on variables for calculating the soundness of banks","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Direct impact of banks’ financial performance on their soundness","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of statistical techniques for categorizing banks based on creditworthiness","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate credit guarantee ratio in a recession","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Suboptimal data science literacy in the health sector","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of regulatory frameworks for data protection","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Delays in authorization of clinical trials and studies by national regulatory bodies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulties in engaging hospitals to participate in observational studies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"General lack of consensus in the interpretation of the general data protection regulation gdpr","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sharing of highly sensitive health data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of interoperability of heterogeneous health-related data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Constraints of sharing and utilizing sensitive health data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of neighborhood social capital limits access to healthcare and information, contributing to disease factors and exacerbating stress.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Discovery of virus with genomic similarity to sars-cov-2 raises concerns about potential for human transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in pandemics over the 20th century","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Link between climate change and infectious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Peri-urbanization of industrial agriculture in the global south","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Higher disease burden in specific subsets of urban populations in the global south","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Intensified animal rearing and complex commodity ’webs’ in the global south","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Domination of techno-scientific concepts over politico-economic factors in delineating causal factors for disease transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inequity in access to basic infrastructure and exposure to environmental contamination","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial segregation of socioeconomic groups leading to disproportionate exposure to environmental toxins and pollutants","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neighborhood-scale inequities in access to social resources leading to health disparities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to untangle the complexities of multi-factorial pathways through which planning impacts urban emergence","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate social adaptive capacity to respond to disturbances","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Urban expansion encroaches on wildlife habitat, creating wuis. human activities in these ’buffer zones’ create stress for wild animals, facilitating viral shedding.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced biodiversity depletes the possibility of alternate hosts for disease humans.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of universal access to critical infrastructures increases susceptibility to disease spreaders causing second wave of infections","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on community volunteers for disaster response","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Transfer of surveillance data management to a u.s. consultancy","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of adaptive governance leading to ineffective response to the pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Weak social capital and lack of trust in the community","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate decentralization of control in healthcare systems","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Panic buying behavior during crises","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate disaster response planning","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate redundancy in production lines or supply chains may lead to disruptions in crucial product availability during a contagious disease outbreak.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate redundancy in data gathering and monitoring systems for covid-19 may result in incomplete or delayed information about hotspots and infected areas, leading to uncontrolled spread of the pollutants","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Healthcare product shortages in high-income nations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"}]}
